Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for data storage, scalability, and access patterns. Identify the applications and services that will use Azure Table Storage.
Design the storage architecture, including partition keys, row keys, and table structure to optimize performance and scalability.
Provision a new Azure Storage Account in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Ensure the account is configured for redundancy and meets performance requirements.
Create and configure Azure Table Storage within the storage account. Define tables and set up initial configurations.
Enable security features such as encryption at rest, shared access signatures (SAS), and role-based access control (RBAC) to secure data in Azure Table Storage.
Configure monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Storage Analytics to track performance, availability, and security metrics.
Perform testing to validate the performance and scalability of Azure Table Storage under expected workloads.
Document the storage account setup, table configurations, and access policies. Provide guidelines for developers and operations teams.
Ensure the storage setup meets regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
Review and optimize storage costs by analyzing usage patterns and applying cost-saving measures such as lifecycle management policies.
